You are given an array of integers $a$ of length $n$ ($2 \le n \le 50$) where $1 \le a_1 \le a_2 \le ... \le a_n \le 100$.  

An array is considered "ugly" if there is an element in the array that is equal to the sum of all the elements before it. Otherwise, it is "beautiful".

Your task is to rearrange the elements of the array $a$ so that the resulting array is beautiful. You can only rearrange the existing elements; you cannot add or remove any elements. If the array is already beautiful, you can leave it unchanged.

For each test case, output:

* "NO" if it is impossible to make the array beautiful.
* "YES" if it is possible to make the array beautiful, followed by the rearranged array.

You are given a list of numbers that are in increasing order.  Determine if you can rearrange the numbers so that no number is equal to the sum of the numbers before it. If you can, output "YES" followed by the rearranged list. If you can't, output "NO".
